briefdescription.para: What node type this node is.
The k parameter (time for OLDER/AFTER, threshold for THRESH(_M)).
The keys used by this expression (only for PK_K/PK_H/MULTI).
The data bytes in this expression (only for HASH160/HASH256/SHA256/RIPEMD10).
Subexpressions (for WRAP_*/AND_*/OR_*/ANDOR/THRESH).
The Script context for this node. Either P2WSH or Tapscript.
Cached ops counts.
Cached stack size bounds.
Cached witness size bounds.
Cached expression type (computed by CalcType and fed through SanitizeType).
Cached script length (computed by CalcScriptLen).

detaileddescription.para: Whether a public key appears more than once in this node. This value is initialized by all constructors except the NoDupCheck ones. The NoDupCheck ones skip the computation, requiring it to be done manually by invoking DuplicateKeyCheck(). DuplicateKeyCheck(), or a non-NoDupCheck constructor, will compute has_duplicate_keys for all subnodes as well.
Update duplicate key information in this Node.
This uses a custom key comparator provided by the context in order to still detect duplicates for more complicated types.

briefdescription.para: Return the size of the script for this expression (faster than ToScript().size()).
Return the maximum number of ops needed to satisfy this script non-malleably.
Return the number of ops in the script (not counting the dynamic ones that depend on execution).
Check the ops limit of this script against the consensus limit.

detaileddescription.para: Whether this node is of type B, K or W. (That is, anything but V.)
Return the maximum number of stack elements needed to satisfy this script non-malleably.

briefdescription.para: Return the maximum size of the stack during execution of this script.
Check the maximum stack size for this script against the policy limit.
Whether no satisfaction exists for this node.

detaileddescription.para: Return the maximum size in bytes of a witness to satisfy this script non-malleably. Note this does not include the witness script push.

briefdescription.para: Return the expression type.
Return the script context for this node.
Find an insane subnode which has no insane children. Nullptr if there is none.

detaileddescription.para: Determine whether a Miniscript node is satisfiable. fn(node) will be invoked for all key, time, and hashing nodes, and should return their satisfiability.

briefdescription.para: Check whether this node is valid at all.
Check whether this node is valid as a script on its own.
Check whether this script can always be satisfied in a non-malleable way.
Check whether this script always needs a signature.
Check whether there is no satisfaction path that contains both timelocks and heightlocks.
Check whether there is no duplicate key across this fragment and all its sub-fragments.
Whether successful non-malleable satisfactions are guaranteed to be valid.
Whether the apparent policy of this node matches its script semantics. Doesn't guarantee it is a safe script on its own.
Check whether this node is safe as a script on its own.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Ctx &ctx, std::vector< std::vector< unsigned char > > &stack, bool nonmalleable=true) const
memberdef.name: Satisfy

detaileddescription.para: Produce a witness for this script, if possible and given the information available in the context. The non-malleable satisfaction is guaranteed to be valid if it exists, and ValidSatisfaction() is true. If IsSane() holds, this satisfaction is guaranteed to succeed in case the node's conditions are satisfied (private keys and hash preimages available, locktimes satisfied).

briefdescription.para: Equality testing.

memberdef.argsstring: (internal::NoDupCheck, MiniscriptContext script_ctx, Fragment nt, std::vector< NodeRef< Key > > sub, std::vector< unsigned char > arg, uint32_t val=0)

memberdef.name: Node

briefdescription.para: Compute the length of the script for this miniscript (including children).

memberdef.argsstring: (State root_state, DownFn downfn, UpFn upfn) const
memberdef.name: TreeEvalMaybe

inbodydescription.para: Entries of the explicit stack tracked in this algorithm.
< How many children of this node have been expanded.

detaileddescription.para: Like TreeEvalMaybe, but without downfn or State type. upfn takes (const Node&, std::span<Result>) and returns std::optional<Result>.
Like TreeEvalMaybe, but always produces a result. upfn must return Result.
Like TreeEval, but without downfn or State type. upfn takes (const Node&, std::span<Result>) and returns Result.

briefdescription.para: Compute the type for this miniscript.

detaileddescription.para: Compare two miniscript subtrees, using a non-recursive algorithm.

briefdescription.para: A node in a miniscript expression.
